lead_paragraph: Courts ordered that dozens of activists be freed a day after Daw Aung San Suu Kyi announced that addressing the cases of political prisoners was a top priority.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe reported from Tharrawaddy, and Richard C. Paddock from Bangkok. Saw Nang contributed reporting from Mandalay, Myanmar.
byline.original: By WAI MOE and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

headline.print_headline: Dozens of Student Activists Are Freed in Myanmar
headline.main: Myanmar Releases Dozens of Student Activists From Jail

snippet: Courts ordered that dozens of activists be freed a day after Daw Aung San Suu Kyi announced that addressing the cases of political prisoners was a top priority.
abstract: Sixty-nine student protestors in Myanmar are released from prison day after de facto leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi says freeing political prisoners and student activists is top priority; students were arrested in 2015 for protesting law curtailing academic freedom and were jailed for year without trial
